summary: Scope expanded beyond fix-only: in addition to internal credential-based admin auth, multilingual fixes, contact/map corrections, and lightweight home/admin UI improvements, the site should add an Agent role with separate login and admin-managed agent accounts, expand the catalog/order system to include Agriculture Machines (and parts) and Organic Home Kitchen Garden products, and update admin order views to clearly show product type across normal/bulk/machine/kitchen-garden orders; also remove the caffeine.ai footer branding and consider adding a lightweight leaf animation on widgets.
architectural_notes: Deliver in phases: implement a simpler MVP first, then expand to full professional feature set.
No external redirects for admin/auth flows; admin login must render within same website UI (popup or internal route).
Keep changes lightweight: no heavy plugins; mobile-friendly; avoid lag/crashes; do not break existing design.
Keep existing product & order flows unchanged; only stabilize issues (image slider, full description).
Fix-only scope: no full site redesign; keep site fast/lightweight; avoid heavy animations and unnecessary sliders.
All newly added content sections must be wired into the existing multilingual system so language switching updates them (no fixed English-only text).
Canonical business info must be consistent everywhere: Rajdhani Beej Bhandar, 8077036783, Ganj Daranagar, Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh, India; and correct Google Map link.
Home page visual enhancements can be more colourful/stylish but must remain lightweight (no heavy animations/lag) and must not break existing flows.
Remove/disable Internet Identity auth; use an internal credential-based admin login flow with proper error messaging and a session that persists until explicit logout.
Introduce role-based access control (RBAC): Admin vs Agent; Agent is read-only for orders/status visibility and cannot access product/content/admin settings.
known_issues: Admin login currently redirects externally / not contained within website UI.
Language switching is stuck in English; site-wide language switch not applying to all content.
Footer contains unwanted branding text (“Built with love using caffeine.ai”) that must be removed.
Site displays incorrect contact number/address in one or more locations (must be updated everywhere).
Google Map embed points to the wrong location / wrong pin (must use provided link).
Internet Identity login is present; must be removed/disabled in favor of internal credential-based admin login.
Bulk order flow is requested to be fixed/implemented so it appears correctly in admin alongside other order types (normal/machine/kitchen garden).

existing_features.title: Implement a Phase 1 MVP scope (simpler version) that delivers a stable, non-crashing Agricultural Products Shop app, and explicitly separate Phase 2 “fully professional” features into a visible backlog list in the UI (e.g., an admin-only “Planned Features” page or a docs page) so the app can be expanded later without rewriting core flows.

Create a coherent, lightweight visual theme for an Indian agricultural shop (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across public pages and the admin dashboard, avoiding blue/purple as the primary palette.

Add a language selection modal shown on first visit that lets the user choose: Hindi, English, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Gujarati, Marathi, Punjabi, Bengali; default language is English. Language switching must be immediate in-app (no full page reload). For Phase 1 MVP, allow non-English languages to fall back to English strings where translations are not yet provided.

Implement a product catalog limited to exactly these categories: Pesticides, Herbicides, Insecticides, Fungicides, Plant Growth Regulators (PGR), Seeds. Prevent creation or display of any other categories.

Build a Phase 1 product browsing experience: Home page with category entry points, a product list page with basic filtering by category, and a product detail page that shows: name, category, price, stock, minimum order quantity, optional bulk order price, multiple images, and full description (no cut-off). If the description is extremely long, optionally use a “Read more” expansion without truncating important content by default.

Fix product image handling on the product detail page: when multiple images exist, display them using either a carousel/slider or a thumbnail-click gallery; never show only a single image when more are available.

Implement a simple Super Admin login for Phase 1: add an “Admin Login” button in the footer; before login, admin controls are hidden; after login, an admin dashboard becomes available. Include an admin logout action. Do not expose the provided password in frontend source code or in any public canister query methods.

Add a Phase 1 Admin Product Manager that supports Add/Edit/Delete products with fields: Name, Category (restricted), Price, Stock, Minimum order quantity, Bulk order price (optional), Multiple images (as URLs for Phase 1 MVP), Full description (unlimited). Changes must reflect immediately in the public catalog views after save.

Implement Phase 1 “Order Now” with two options: (1) Order via Website: a checkout form capturing Full Name, Mobile Number, Full Address, City, State, Pincode, with product details auto-filled and quantity editable; on submit, store the order in the backend with status. (2) Order via WhatsApp: redirect to WhatsApp with an auto-generated message containing product name, price, and quantity. Defer the Bulk Order/Dealer Enquiry flow to Phase 2.

Add Phase 1 Admin Order Management: a list view of website orders with customer details, product details, quantity, created time, and status; allow admin to update status between Pending, Confirmed, Completed. Bulk Orders section should be present but empty/disabled with a “Planned for Phase 2” label (no bulk order creation in Phase 1).
Embed a Google Map on a Contact page (or Home page if Contact is not implemented) using the provided location link, ensuring it loads safely and does not crash the app if the embed fails.

Add robust error handling and loading states for all Phase 1 backend calls (products, orders, admin auth) and ensure the app remains stable under invalid inputs (e.g., missing fields, invalid quantity, network/canister call errors).

Ensure Admin Login stays fully inside the website UI with no external redirects: keep a small “Admin Login” button in the footer, and when clicked it must open an in-app modal or an internal route (same site layout) for admin authentication; after successful login, admin controls/routes become visible; before login, admin controls must not be visible to normal users.

Redesign the Admin Dashboard to be more attractive and professional while staying lightweight: use a clean card-style dashboard with simple icons and hover-only micro-interactions; include dashboard options/cards for Edit Text, Edit Images, Manage Products, Orders, and Gallery; keep a neutral professional look that works in both light and dark mode.

Update the Home page hero section to show the shop name in big, bold text: “RAJDHANI BEEJ BHANDAR”, with an optional subtitle (e.g., “Trusted Agricultural Products Store”); the hero title/subtitle must be editable by admin and must be supported per language (admin can set values separately for each language).

Fully fix the language system so the entire website content changes instantly when a user selects a language (no full reload), remembers the selected language, and defaults to English. Supported languages must include: Hindi, English, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada, Gujarati, Marathi, Punjabi, Bengali (and keep any currently-supported languages already present). This must apply site-wide to menus, buttons, headings, forms, footer text, and all product-facing content (including product names and product descriptions).

Add admin tooling to manage translations/content per language from the dashboard: admins must be able to edit (1) product name/description per language and (2) site text content used in the hero (title/subtitle) per language, using simple forms in the admin area; translation editing must be easy to add/update and changes must reflect immediately in public pages after save.
Remove the footer branding text and link “© 2026. Built with love using caffeine.ai” from the website; after removal, no footer text or link should mention caffeine.ai.

Add an admin-only feature to capture and persist a single “Reference Website” URL (the site the user wants to emulate) and optional design notes, so future UI work can explicitly target that reference.

Expose the saved Reference Website URL (read-only) somewhere in the existing admin area as a reminder for future redesign work (e.g., a small card/section on the Admin Dashboard or on the Planned Features page).

Fix Admin Login so the admin login entry point never redirects to Caffeine AI or any other external app/platform. The Admin Login must open inside the same website (either an in-app modal or an internal route under the same domain). After successful login, admin dashboard/navigation must become visible; before login, admin controls must remain hidden for normal users.

Update shop contact identity across the entire UI to the correct details and ensure there are no remaining incorrect/old values anywhere they are displayed (header, footer, Contact page, and any popup/form that shows contact info). Use exactly: Shop Name: "Rajdhani Beej Bhandar"; Contact Number: "8077036783"; Address: "Ganj Daranagar, Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh, India".

Fix the Google Map location so it points to "Rajdhani Beej Bhandar" using ONLY this provided location link: https://maps.app.goo.gl/1nXnfAyBe6BFAnA87. Update both the embedded map and the "Open in Google Maps" link so they consistently open the correct location (no wrong pin).

Strengthen the Home page top/hero area and add three simple professional feature boxes below it (no heavy animation). Feature box text must be exactly: (1) "Genuine Agricultural Products" (2) "Expert Guidance for Farmers" (3) "Easy Ordering & Bulk Supply". Use small, clean icons (lightweight; no sliders/carousels).

Add an "About Us" section with the provided content to the public site, and make it admin-editable later. The About Us content must support multi-language switching (same instant in-app language switching behavior as existing hero/product translations).

Extend the existing translation/i18n system so all newly added UI text (Home feature boxes labels, About Us heading/content, contact labels if shown, and any new footer/header contact copy) is language-aware and updates immediately when the user switches language. Do not leave any newly added user-facing strings permanently fixed to English.

Add a dedicated WhatsApp Enquiry option (separate from ordering) that lets users quickly message the shop on WhatsApp with a prefilled enquiry message, using the existing WhatsApp number in CONTACT_INFO.whatsappNumber.

Make the Home page more colourful and stylish while keeping it lightweight and consistent with the existing design/flows (no heavy animations), by enhancing the Home page section styling, backgrounds, and card treatments.

Add a new frontend admin auth state (separate from Internet Identity) that supports: login with username/password, showing an English error message for wrong credentials, persisting the admin session token locally, restoring the session on page refresh, and logging out (clearing the session token) so the admin session remains active until logout.

Replace the existing Internet Identity-based admin UI components and route protection to use the new credential-based admin session. Update AdminLoginModal, AdminAuthControls, AdminRouteGuard, and AppLayout admin visibility so they rely on token-based admin status instead of Internet Identity identity state.

Update all frontend admin-related React Query hooks and mutations that currently call admin-protected backend methods so they pass the admin session token and continue to work with the new backend authorization. This includes product mutations, order status updates, translation updates, and reference website saving/loading.

Ensure the application no longer depends on Internet Identity for any admin authentication behavior, without editing immutable frontend files. InternetIdentityProvider may remain mounted (due to immutable frontend entry file), but it must not be required for admin login, admin session persistence, actor creation for admin calls, or route protection.
Add an Agent authentication system with a separate in-app “Agent Login” entry point that does not redirect outside the website.
Add an Admin UI section to manage agents (create/edit/delete) with fields: username, mobile number, password, and agent role.
Add an Agent-only Orders page that displays all orders and their statuses, and ensure agents cannot access any admin product/content management routes.
Extend the data model so each order clearly includes a “Product type” value, with exact labels: “Agri product”, “Machine”, “Kitchen Garden”, and show this in Admin order details.

Add public-facing catalog entry points for “Agriculture Machines” and for “Organic Home Kitchen Garden products”, and ensure orders created from these sections are tagged with the correct product type.
Update the Admin Dashboard/Order Management view so “All orders (normal, bulk, machine, kitchen garden)” are clearly visible and distinguishable, including product type on each row.
Remove the footer branding text and link that says "© 2026. Built with ❤️ using caffeine.ai" from the website footer, and ensure no footer text or link anywhere in the UI mentions "caffeine.ai".

Fix the Google Maps embed so it reliably points to the exact Rajdhani Beej Bhandar location using ONLY the provided location link (https://maps.app.goo.gl/1nXnfAyBe6BFAnA87), and ensure both the embedded map and the "Open in Google Maps" button open the same correct location (no wrong pin).

Make the Contact page map/location section look more professional and stylish while staying lightweight (no heavy animations), improving spacing, card treatment, and map frame presentation without changing the core content.

Product page behavior: multi-image carousel/thumbnail view when multiple images exist; show full description (optional read-more only for very long content)
Order system with 3 options: Website checkout form (stores orders + status workflow), WhatsApp redirect with prefilled message, Bulk Order/Dealer Enquiry form stored separately
Admin Order Management разделы: separate Normal Orders vs Bulk Orders; status updates (Pending/Confirmed/Completed) for website orders
Home page bottom Photo Gallery (Before Use / After Use) with admin add/delete/edit captions; lightweight performance

Implement a credential-based admin authentication system in the backend (Motoko) that does not depend on Internet Identity, using the provided admin credentials (Username: ABYSSSHAVEZ, Password: S2182007n4299781@). The backend must (a) validate credentials securely, (b) create a server-issued admin session token on successful login, (c) provide a way to validate the session token, and (d) provide a logout action that invalidates the session token.

Refactor backend admin-only operations to authorize using the new admin session token (not the caller principal / Internet Identity). All existing admin-only operations (products CRUD, order management, translation updates, and reference website CRUD) must require a valid admin session token and must trap/return an authorization error if the token is missing or invalid.
